meanings.definition: To make or become thoroughly wet or saturated.
meanings.sent1: After playing in the rain, my clothes were completely sogged.
meanings.sent2: The sponge quickly sogged up all the spilled water on the counter.
meanings.sent3: The poor cat looked quite sogged after getting caught in the downpour.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits were sogged with disappointment when the event got canceled.
meanings.sent5: The muddy ground sogged under our feet as we trudged through the field.

meanings.definition: To be weighed down or burdened with moisture.
meanings.sent1: The wet laundry sogged heavily in the basket.
meanings.sent2: The old books on the shelf were sogged from the leak in the roof.
meanings.sent3: The tree branches were sogged with raindrops, making them droop.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt sogged with worry about the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella became sogged with rainwater, making it difficult to hold up.
